Reviews.Title: “Quick stop over”
Reviews.Author: JMertz
Reviews.Content: Place was exactly what we needed. Were only in Amsterdam for the one night, and knew we'd spend most of it out on the town so all we were after was a bed for a few hours. It was very cost effective and did exactly what we wanted it to. There were four of us, we were all in the same room and there was a toilet and shower nearby. It was fine for what it was, but don't be expecting the Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Amsterdam Hostel Centre”
Reviews.Author: Matias S
Reviews.Content: The Hostel is very well located, the bedroom was Ok, but the bathrooms were not that clean. Its a place to sleep.... I would recomend to people who dont have problems if not fancy Hostels

Reviews.Title: “Crappy, no money value!”
Reviews.Author: fbrancucci
Reviews.Content: Stayed in for 2 nights with friends but would definitely not recommend this place to anyone. This place was wet, not clean at all (I even wonder if blanket are changed after the check out) and dangerous socket to plug your stuff in. Didn't even tried the breakfast. No curtains, noisy streets (well that not the worst). For this price you can find far much better in AMS.

Reviews.Title: “Awful, no value for money, overcrowded”
Reviews.Author: lechugas00
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at hotel Granada in October 2008. The worst hotel I have ever stayed in. The place is an old building with four or five floors. The first one has the reception and breakfast lounge; the rest of the floors have 3 rooms each, one shower and one toilet (absolutely tiny). We booked the 6-bed room, which was the smallest. The other rooms of the floor were bigger, I assume there could easily be 10-12 beds, that is, kind of 30 people for each shower (it was better not to think about it) Rooms were filthy, there were stains on the mattresses, no wardrobes, bad smell... Only the location was positive. And the staff, who was quite friendly too. All in all, I would not recommend it in any case.

Reviews.Title: “Bad smell”
Reviews.Author: manteLondon
Reviews.Content: This place is absolutely awful! Definatly would not reccomend to anyone I know! The stairwell stinks. We had to hold our breath from the bottom to the top floor! Bad times! When we got there they had mucked up our booking- we booked a room for 6 and were given a room for 4 with no discount for their cock up! The room had insects and no privacy from the sleeping area into the bathroom ( by bathroom I mean very smelly shower and a sink) The room that we moved into after 2 nights was not much better because we were situated next to the water tank or something and the water dripping noise kept us up all night! however the bathroom had a door so at least we could all wash in private! On the plus side because we couldn't bare to be in the room any longer than we had to we had an amazing trip! Please do not stay here

Reviews.Title: “Rude and lazy”
Reviews.Author: euchrid
Reviews.Content: The staff here are rude, lazy and totally disinterested in helping you. My room was overbooked, meaning that when I got back in the middle of the night every bed was taken. With reception closed I had to sleep on the floor. The staff were totally disinterested and refused to refund any money. Never stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here ever”
Reviews.Author: samallttocs
Reviews.Content: Do not ever stay here, its rubbish. Rooms are dirty and very small. There is no security in the room, no lockers. Bed sheets were dirty and ripped. Toilets and bathroom were very very small and dirty. Hostel staff was not very friendly or helpful. Room was very overpriced. Worst hostel i have ever stayed in in all of Europe..

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: gooseprint
Reviews.Content: The hotel was filthy dirty, no clean sheets, no working or useable showers. Incredibly cramped room. We were walking up 70 incredibly narrow stairs just to get to our room. The whole hotel smells like a toilet. The breakfast included in the price consisted of a slice of bread with various spreads. The staff were very poor, very disorganised and unhelpful. I was expecting it to be a budget hotel, but this place isnt worth a penny of anyones.

Reviews.Title: “good location but not a hotel”
Reviews.Author: corkman2000
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in November for my 50 th birthday. It was a big dissappointment. The room was clean and quiet small. We found the staff to be very rude and not at all helpful. One day I asked for a simple cup of tea and it was such a big deal, it took 15 minutes!!!! Would not stay here again, there is such a great choice of hotels in Amsterdam and my advice would be to avoid this one!!!!!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: ohio middle of woods in my teepee
Reviews.Title: “found a cheep place to stay”
Reviews.Author: cowboyamsterdam
Reviews.Content: It was the first time my sweet heart and me went to europe and started out trip off with a flight delay so we arived 24 hours late for our reservation but apon ariving found thay still kept our room.The granada is a buget hotel set in the heart of the leidseplin district so all the first floors have resturents on them a short walk down a walking street and one floorup we wer standing in the quaint lobby it took only a short time to regester for our room and then we wer standing on the 5th floor of our double room with a shower & WC it was just hte place we hoped to find.First thing in the room she opened the window and found the aroma of the naborhood you can travle the world with your tastbuds in just a few blocks. Just a stones throw from the front doors of the granada we found a very inviting zorba de griek restaurant the first and no the last place that we found our selves drawn too with very good results I might add it made the perfict start to our adventurs that night with all of amsterdams night life just a short walk away. The next morning I had the holtel man put our breakfist on a tray to take to our rooms where we injoyed it in privet the first of a full week of a adventure that my sweet heat and I will remeber forever . For a buget hotele we had every thing we could ask for saveing so much from a a bigger hotele we wer able to take the train to paris for the night some thing I would sujest to any one given a chance too. Injoy your adventure in life as much as you can.

HotelInfo.Name: Amsterdam Hostel Centre
HotelInfo.Address: Leidsekruisstraat 13-1, Amsterdam 1017 RE, The Netherlands (Formerly Hotel Granada)
